cities.name: Caracas
cities.description: Venezuela's vibrant capital city with colonial architecture, mountain views, and rich culture

challenges.caption: Visit the historic Plaza Bolivar and take a photo with the statue
Try an authentic Venezuelan arepa at a local restaurant
Find and photograph a colorful street art mural
Take the cable car up to Avila mountain and enjoy the view
Have breakfast with a traditional cachapa
Visit the historic Caracas Cathedral
Explore a local market and try fresh tropical fruit
Take a photo at the iconic Parque Central towers
Enjoy a traditional pabellón criollo meal
Ride the Caracas metro system
Share tequeños with friends at a café
Visit the Teresa Carreño Cultural Center
Take a peaceful walk through the Botanical Garden
Try the famous Venezuelan quesillo dessert
Photograph a beautiful colonial house facade
Visit the Museum of Fine Arts
Grab a fresh empanada from a street vendor
Relax by the lake at Parque del Este
Find someone playing the traditional cuatro instrument
Pay respects at the Panteón Nacional
Buy a handmade souvenir from a local artisan
Capture the Caracas skyline at night
Try the traditional chicha beverage
Watch a street performer and leave a tip

cities.name: Cádiz
cities.description: Culture & History · Nature & Outdoors · Food & Drink · Movement & Exploration · Nightlife & Ambience · Photo & Video Challenges

challenges.caption: Stroll along La Caleta Beach at sunset and feel like you’re walking through a movie scene.
Climb the Torre Tavira for panoramic views and a fascinating peek through the Camera Obscura.
Get lost in Cádiz’s Old Town streets and find a tiny tapas bar to grab a quick bite.
Marvel at the golden dome of Cádiz Cathedral and enjoy the breezy plaza surrounding it.
Explore the ancient Roman Theatre and imagine the performances that once filled its stands.
Admire the colorful flower stalls and lively atmosphere of Plaza de las Flores as you soak in the heart of local life.
Step inside the Cádiz Museum to uncover Phoenician, Roman, and modern treasures. Find the two Phoenician sarcophagi on the ground floor — they’re the stars of the collection.
Take a relaxed walk through Parque Genovés and admire its beautifully sculpted greenery.
Walk the entire causeway to Castillo de San Sebastián and take a picture where the waves crash against the walkway.
Visit the Castillo de Santa Catalina for coastal views and inspiring art exhibitions. Find a photo from the 1947 explosion that shows its devastation.
Dive into the Mercado Central and taste fresh seafood straight from the Atlantic.
Wander along the Paseo Marítimo and enjoy ocean breezes and cheerful local energy.
Grab a drink at "Circo Duende Arte + Bar" and soak in Cádiz’s lively nightlife with its cozy vibe and live music.
Join a Carnival workshop or event to feel the spirit of Spain’s most iconic festival.
Take a day trip to charming nearby beaches like Playa de la Victoria.
Enjoy churros with chocolate at a traditional café for an irresistible morning treat.
Rent a bike and explore the coastline at your own pace.
Listen to live flamenco and feel the emotion of authentic Andalusian culture.
Sail or kayak around the bay for a refreshing look at the city from the water.
Visit the Oratorio de San Felipe Neri, birthplace of Spain’s first constitution.
Try tortillitas de camarones, Cádiz’s crispy shrimp fritters, and savor local flavor.
Walk through the narrow streets of Barrio La Viña and snap a photo of its colorful facades.
Catch a local performance at the Gran Teatro Falla and revel in its magnificent setting.
Simply sit by the sea with an ice cream and appreciate how Cádiz makes time slow down.

cities.name: Madrid
cities.description: Madrid blends royal landmarks, world-class art, and a buzzing food scene into a city made for wandering. From sunny plazas to late-night tapas, every neighborhood has its own rhythm. It’s vibrant, warm, and always alive — the perfect place to explore, taste, and get a little lost.

challenges.caption: El Retiro Park – Go to El Retiro Park and rent a rowboat to paddle around the lake.
Puerta del Sol – Go around the statue of el Oso y el Madroño and touch its tail for good luck.
Plaza Mayor – Sit on the square eating a classic calamari sandwich (bocadillo de calamares) with alioli.
Gran Vía – See if you can spot Bumblebee (from Transformers) and get a photo with him.
El Rastro – Find a vintage item for under 5€ (bargaining is encouraged). Make sure that you on a Sunday before it closes at 3pm.
Royal Palace – Find the armor of King Charles V.
Malasaña – Go on a pub crawl and try every kind of beer.
Bernabéu Stadium – Find the pub inside the stadium and enjoy a drink (and the view).
Plaza de España – Walk around the square and see how many mini fountains you can spot.
Mercado de San Miguel – Go to this local market and try a tapa you have never tasted before.
Templo de Debod – Go the temple and enjoy one of the best sunset views in Madrid.
Almudena Cathedral – Climb to the top and see if you if you can spot the tiny angel statue hidden on the rooftop.
Museo del Prado – See if you can find the “Meninas”, one of the most famous paintings inside the museum.
Casa de Campo – Take the cable car for an epic view of the city.
La Latina – Get a drink at one of those iconic wooden barrels that double as standing tables.
Atocha Monument — Stand under the “Forest of the Absent” and count how many trees you can see without moving your feet.
Plaza de Colón – Go on a bench and enjoy a well-deserved break after a long day of walking around.
Lavapiés – Go to the square and try a non-Spanish dish.
Chamberí Ghost Station — Step onto the old platform and try to spot the original 1919 tile ads that are still perfectly preserved.
Faro de Moncloa — Ride up to the observation deck and try to identify at least three Madrid landmarks from above without checking your phone.
Crystal Palace (inside el Retiro) – Capture your reflection in the glass for an artistic shot.
Ponzano – Go to this famous street and try to meet local people and enjoy a drink.
Paseo la Castellana – Take a stroll in this iconic avenue.
Plaza de Olavide – Go to this square and enjoy an afternoon like a real Madrileño.

cities.name: Paris
cities.description: Culture & History • Nature & Outdoors • Food & Drink • Shopping & Markets • Art & Creativity • Photo & Video Challenges • Puzzles & Clues • Social & Interaction • Movement & Exploration • Sports & Play • Nightlife & Ambience • Audio / Sound-Based • Group Challenges

challenges.caption: Eiffel Tower Visit — Walk a full circle around the base and find the plaque showing the tower’s height. Look up and notice how the structure changes shape as you move.
Seine River Walk or Cruise — Pause on a bridge, watch the water for a full minute, and count how many boats pass in either direction.
Louvre Museum Visit — After seeing the Mona Lisa, choose one artwork in a quieter room and read the entire description label before moving on.
Tuileries Garden Break — Sit in a green chair and observe five different people. Notice what each one is doing and how long they stay.
Notre-Dame Cathedral Exterior — Walk around the building and find a detail you might miss at first glance, such as a carving, relief, or inscription.
Île Saint-Louis Stop — Buy ice cream and eat it while walking the perimeter of the island, staying close to the river the entire time.
Latin Quarter Walk — Step into a bookstore or stationery shop and find a book or notebook you would buy if you lived in Paris.
Panthéon Visit — Choose one person honored inside whom you didn’t know before and read why they are buried there.
Luxembourg Gardens Visit — Watch the toy sailboats and follow one with your eyes until it reaches the edge of the pool.
Montmartre Walk — Take a slower route uphill and notice how the streets narrow and widen as you climb.
Sacré-Cœur Viewpoint — Look out over the city and pick one area you want to explore later. Make a mental note of its direction.
Place du Tertre Stop — Observe an artist from start to finish on one small detail of their process, such as shading or outlining.
Paris Métro Ride — Study the station signage and typography, then listen for how many different languages you hear spoken.
Champs-Élysées Walk — Walk one full block without looking at any luxury brands and focus only on architecture and street activity.
Arc de Triomphe Visit — Stand beneath the arch and notice how traffic flows around it. Look up at the carved names overhead.
Musée d’Orsay Visit — Choose one artwork and trace where your eye naturally moves across the piece before reading about it.
Saint-Germain Café Stop — Sit outside, finish your drink slowly, and write down one observation about Paris life that surprises you.
Le Marais Walk — Enter at least one courtyard and notice how the atmosphere changes the moment you step inside.
Place des Vosges Visit — Walk along all four sides of the square and notice how the arcades frame the space differently.
Centre Pompidou Exterior — Identify the escalator path and follow it visually from bottom to top before entering or moving on.
Canal Saint-Martin Walk — Watch the water during the lock process and notice how the level changes relative to the walls.

Crêpe Stop in Montparnasse — Go to La Crêperie de Josselin and order a classic savory galette followed by a sweet crêpe. Eat them slowly and notice how different the texture is from crêpes you’ve had elsewhere.

Classic Parisian Meal — Go to Bouillon Chartier, order a traditional French dish (like steak-frites or boeuf bourguignon), and take a moment to notice the dining room, the pace of service, and how locals eat around you.
Evening Seine Walk — When the Eiffel Tower sparkles, stop walking and watch the entire light sequence from beginning to end.

cities.name: Miami
cities.description: Miami blends tropical beaches, bold art, and nonstop energy into a city that lives outdoors. From pastel streets and oceanfront walks to Cuban flavors and late-night scenes, it’s vibrant, warm, and effortlessly fun — a place where culture, sun, and rhythm come together.

challenges.caption: South Beach – Walk along Ocean Drive and snap a picture with the iconic pastel Art Deco buildings.
Little Havana – Order a Cuban coffee and enjoy it standing at a local café like the locals do.
Wynwood Walls – Find the most colorful mural and take a photo in front of it.
Miami Seaquarium – Watch a dolphin show and try to guess how many dolphins are in the pool.
Vizcaya Museum and Gardens – Explore the Italian Renaissance-style gardens and try to find the hidden staircase leading to the waterfront.
Lincoln Road – Window-shop along this pedestrian-friendly street and grab an ice cream from one of the local shops.
Miami Design District – Take a selfie with the colorful “Fly’s Eye Dome” sculpture.
Coconut Grove – Take a stroll along the charming streets, find a café, and enjoy a fresh mojito (or an iced coffee).
Coral Castle – Take a stroll along the charming streets, find a café, and enjoy a fresh mojito.
Key Biscayne – Visit Crandon Park and collect a seashell from the beach as a souvenir.
Cubano Sandwich – Try a classic Cubano sandwich from any Cuban café or restaurant and rate it—does it have the perfect balance of flavors?
Bayside Marketplace – Take a boat ride around Biscayne Bay and spot Star Island’s celebrity homes.
Miami International Mall – Spend a few minutes finding the most unique piece of fashion and share it with a friend.
Freedom Tower – Take a moment to learn about Miami’s immigrant history at the Freedom Tower Museum.
Jungle Island – Find a rare animal you’ve never seen before and take a photo with it.
Miami Beach Botanical Garden – Walk through the tropical garden and identify at least three types of plants native to Florida.
Lummus Park – Try playing beach volleyball with new people or join a game.
South Pointe Park – Walk to the end of the pier and look out at the Atlantic Ocean, taking in the views of Miami Beach and Fisher Island.
Sawgrass Mills Mall – Visit the mall and find the best deal on an item you’ve been wanting—bonus if you find a hidden gem in one of the outlet stores!
Miami’s Historic District – Walk around the oldest part of Miami and find the oldest building still standing.
Everglades National Park – Take an airboat ride and try to spot an alligator before the guide points it out.
Wynwood Yard – Visit a food truck and try a dish you've never tasted before.
Miami Design Preservation League – Take a walking tour to learn about the history of Miami’s Art Deco district and the architectural styles that make it unique.
The Wolfsonian-FIU Museum – Explore the fascinating collection of art, design, and propaganda from the 20th century.

cities.name: Test City
cities.description: A test city for verifying BeanGo expandability

challenges.caption: Visit landmark 1
Visit landmark 2
Visit landmark 3
